alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Davie; Iredell; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 11:05AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN THE NORTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA PIEDMONT UNTIL 7 PM EDT... A dry and seasonal air mass will remain over the area today. This will allow relative humidity values to drop below 20 percent this afternoon and early evening in the northwest North Carolina Piedmont, some parts of which have not seen a soaking rainfall in over a week, so fuels such as dead brush and leaf debris are becoming very dry. The dry fuels combined with northwesterly winds of 10 to 15 mph at times, with a few gusts over 20 mph, will raise fire danger. Please refer to your local burn permitting authorities on whether you can burn today. If you do burn, use extreme caution since fires can quickly get out of hand under these conditions.
